verses.text: I too am a mortal, the same as all others, a descendant of the first-formed, created from earth.
verses.comment: The speaker is King Solomon, stressing that wisdom does not come from special birth but from God. Connects to Adam’s creation, showing universal human nature.

verses.text: In the womb of a mother I was molded into flesh, during ten months in blood, from seed by man and the pleasure that attends sleep.
verses.comment: Underscores the natural and humble process of human birth, emphasizing that wisdom is not inherited by genealogy.

verses.text: When I was born, I too inhaled the common air and fell upon the earth, first crying like all newborns.
verses.comment: Common birth shared with all humanity, affirming every person’s equal access to wisdom by God’s grace.

verses.text: I was nursed in swaddling clothes and cared for with worry.
verses.comment: Contrast between human vulnerability and the divine gift of wisdom that elevates man.

verses.text: No king began life differently; all have one entrance into life and one exit.
verses.comment: Unifying human experience; wisdom’s source is divine, not hereditary or based on social status.

verses.text: Therefore, I prayed, and understanding was given to me; I called upon God, and the spirit of wisdom came to me.
verses.comment: Prayer is key to receiving wisdom—a theme fulfilled in the New Testament when believers ask for divine wisdom.

verses.text: I valued her above scepters and thrones, and I counted riches as nothing beside her.
verses.comment: Wisdom is personified as a woman, foreshadowing the New Testament’s emphasis on Christ as true wisdom (see 1 Cor. 1:30).

verses.text: Neither compared I her to precious stones, because all gold beside her is a little sand, and silver shall be counted as clay before her.
verses.comment: Earthly treasures pale in comparison to wisdom. Reflects teachings of Jesus about choosing the kingdom above material wealth.

verses.text: I loved her more than health and beauty, and I chose to have her instead of light, because her radiance never fades.
verses.comment: The never-fading light of wisdom suggests divine light—fulfilled in Christ as the true light of the world.

verses.text: All good things came to me together with her, and countless riches through her hands.
verses.comment: All true blessings are given through wisdom. The theme of participation in God’s gifts points towards receiving spiritual graces.

verses.text: I rejoiced in them all, because wisdom leads them; though I did not know that she was the mother of these.
verses.comment: Wisdom is the source of all good, with a maternal image hinting at wisdom’s nurturing and generative role.

verses.text: What I learned without guile, I share without grudging; I do not hide her riches.
verses.comment: Wisdom is meant to be shared, resonating with Jesus’ command to generously share spiritual gifts.

verses.text: For wisdom is an inexhaustible treasure to people; those who acquire her become friends of God, praised by his gifts through instruction.
verses.comment: Wisdom brings friendship with God, anticipating New Testament language of sharing in God’s nature and becoming children of God.

verses.text: God has granted me the knowledge to speak justly. Wisdom flows from him, and he teaches us what is upright.
verses.comment: Divinely granted speech—echoes prophetic inspiration and apostolic teaching authority.

verses.text: For wisdom knows both the past and future; she interprets signs and wonders, and the turning of seasons and times.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s comprehensive knowledge overlaps with the Omniscience of God; all understanding flows from Him.

verses.text: She knows the beginning and end of times, and the changes in customs and speech.
verses.comment: Echoes biblical themes of wisdom overseeing all history—prefigures Christ as Alpha and Omega.

verses.text: She can recount hidden things and foretell what is to come; she understands words, solutions, and riddles.
verses.comment: Wisdom is able to penetrate mysteries—a role later fulfilled in Christ revealing the mysteries of God’s plan.

verses.text: She has mastery over signs and wonders, the ordering of times and seasons.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s oversight of creation—even over seasons—shows her foundational role in the cosmos.

verses.text: She understands what is good and what is evil, the course of events, human passions, and the secrets of hearts.
verses.comment: Wisdom searches hearts—a divine attribute pointing towards Jesus’ insight into man’s interior.

verses.text: She possesses all knowledge—whether of crafts and sciences, or forces and powers.
verses.comment: God is the source of all true knowledge, theological and scientific—no contradiction.

verses.text: All that is secret or manifest I learned, for wisdom, the fashioner of all things, taught me.
verses.comment: Wisdom characterized as co-creator—clear prefiguration of the Word through whom all things were made.

verses.text: For in wisdom there is a spirit that is intelligent, holy, unique, manifold, subtle, active, clear, undefiled, distinct, loving what is good, keen, unhindered, benevolent, steadfast, unassailable,
verses.comment: List of wisdom’s attributes, many shared with the Holy Spirit, prefiguring the fullness of God's gift to the Church.

verses.text: All-powerful, all-seeing, all-penetrating spirits that moves through all pure and subtle things.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s pervasive presence and power, reflecting God’s omnipresence.

verses.text: For wisdom is more mobile than any movement; she passes through and penetrates all things by her purity.
verses.comment: Her ‘mobility’ suggests the workings of the Spirit, moving wherever God wills.

verses.text: For she is the breath of the power of God and a pure outpouring of the glory of the Almighty; therefore nothing defiled enters into her.
verses.comment: Wisdom as ‘breath’ points to the doctrine of the Holy Spirit proceeding from the Father, essential to the fullness of the Church.

verses.text: For she is the radiance of eternal light, a spotless mirror of God’s working, and an image of his goodness.
verses.comment: Wisdom as ‘radiance’ and ‘image’ directly parallels the description of Christ as the exact imprint of God’s nature, supporting the teaching of Christ’s divinity.

verses.text: Though one, she can do all things; remaining in herself, she renews all things. She passes into holy souls in every generation, making them friends of God and prophets.
verses.comment: Shows wisdom’s continuous operation in believers, empowering and sanctifying them—consistent with doctrines on grace working through the Church in every age.

verses.text: God loves nothing except one who lives with wisdom.
verses.comment: A loving relationship is established through possession of wisdom, echoing the union with Christ that is the heart of Christian life.

verses.text: She is more beautiful than the sun, and surpasses every constellation; compared with light, she is found superior.
verses.comment: The supremacy of wisdom above created light hints at the divinity of Christ, as ‘true light’ in the New Testament.

verses.text: For night overcomes light, but evil will not prevail against wisdom.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s victory over evil prefigures the ultimate triumph of Christ over the darkness of sin and death.
